definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: The bells are attached by black leather or webbing straps.
sentences.chinese: 肩甲与胸甲用皮革或带子连接。

sentences.english: After the tortoise is anesthetized the bottom of the shell is cleansed thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 当乌龟被麻醉后，他的胸甲要被彻底清洗干净。

sentences.english: They have also head-pieces and breastplates, in like manner as have all the footmen.
sentences.chinese: 他们也装备了胸甲和头盔，样式和步兵相同。

sentences.english: The rest of the cuirass was also iron plate covered with leather on top with laminated segments below.
sentences.chinese: 其余的胸甲也与下面的夹层段上的皮革覆盖的铁板。

sentences.english: This photo shows only the carapace, with their distinctive reticulate surface ornamentation.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片显示，只有在胸甲，其独特的网状面装饰品。

sentences.english: Tortoises seem to preferentially put the available calcium in the plastron.
sentences.chinese: 龟们似乎更喜欢把可用的钙质添加到他们的胸甲中。

sentences.english: An adult body shell (or carapace) may measure up to 116mm across.
sentences.chinese: 一只成年红蟹的外壳，即胸甲能达到116毫米宽。

sentences.english: After the tortoise is anesthetized the bottom of the shell (called the plastron) is cleansed thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 当乌龟被麻醉后，他的胸甲要被彻底清洗干净。

sentences.english: The surcoat is worn over the codpiece, and under the chest armor and belt.
sentences.chinese: 内袍覆盖护阴甲，需穿在胸甲和皮带的下面。
